text: Mahammad Ali Tarbiat ( ; born May 26, 1877 in Nobar, Tabriz, East Azerbaijan — death January 17, 1940 in Tehran) was an Iranian Revolutionary and politician. He founded the Tarbiat library which was the first library in Iran. Tarbiat was a writer active in the Iranian Constitutional Revolution and a member of the National Consultative Assembly from the electorate of Tabriz (1931-1940). ==See also== * Tarbiyat street ==References== * Category:People from Tabriz Category:1877 births Category:1940 deaths Category:Iranian Azerbaijani politicians Category:Iranian Azerbaijani revolutionaries Category:Iranian journalists Category:People of the Persian Constitutional Revolution Category:Deputies of Tabriz for National Consultative Assembly Category:Mayors of Tabriz Category:Iranian Azerbaijani writers Category:Democrat Party (Persia) politicians Tarbiat
title: Mahammad Ali Tarbiat
